page.title: 13Longridge Estate
page.content: House,grounds,lodges,stables etc, were bought by Capt. Collingwood Thompson, and the house let to Miss Gordon-Smith Who turned it into a girls school, boarders,weekly boarders and day-girls and the Collingwood Thompsons moved into the stables.Because of high running costs,in 1939 the school moved to more viable accomodation and the army took over for the duration of the 1939_45 war.When released,the building was bought by a consortium of business men,turned into an hotel without success and again sold to a Catholic Order,who transferred their school from Berwick.It was run successfully until 1982,during which time a Chapel and swimming pool were built. The Nuns,who were a popular part of the local community,had to leave the area because of a lack of teaching nuns and its closure was regretted.
